title: Describe sampling distribution for mean wait time

content.description: At a certain restaurant, the distribution of wait times between ordering a meal and receiving the meal has mean <math alttext="11.4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and standard deviation <math alttext="2.6" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2.6</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> minutes. The restaurant manager wants to find the probability that the mean wait time will be greater than <math alttext="12.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes for a random sample of <math alttext="84" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>84</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> customers.
content.question: Assuming the wait times among customers are independent, which of the following describes the sampling distribution of the sample mean wait time for random samples of size <math alttext="84" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>84</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> ?

choices.label: Approximately normal with mean <math alttext="11.4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and standard deviation <math alttext="2.6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes

Approximately normal with mean <math alttext="11.4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and standard deviation <math alttext="the fraction 2.6 over the square root of 84" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>84</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> minute

Approximately normal with mean <math alttext="12.0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and standard deviation <math alttext="2.6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes

Binomial with mean <math alttext="84 times 0.41" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>84</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.41</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and standard deviation <math alttext=" the square root of 84 times 0.41, times 0.59, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>84</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.41</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.59</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes

Binomial with mean <math alttext="84 times 0.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>84</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and standard deviation <math alttext=" the square root of 84 times 0.5, times 0.5, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>84</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes

content.answer: Approximately normal with mean <math alttext="11.4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>11.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes and standard deviation <math alttext="the fraction 2.6 over the square root of 84" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>84</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> minute
